verses.kjv: Lo, mine eye hath seen all this, mine ear hath heard and understood it.
verses.ct: Look, my eyes have seen all of this, and my ears have heard and understood it.

verses.kjv: What ye know, the same do I know also: I am not inferior unto you.
verses.ct: Everything you know, I know too — I am not less capable than you.

verses.kjv: Surely I would speak to the Almighty, and I desire to reason with God.
verses.ct: But I want to speak to the Almighty; I want to argue my case with God.

verses.kjv: But ye are forgers of lies, ye are all physicians of no value.
verses.ct: You, however, are inventors of lies — all of you are worthless doctors.

verses.kjv: O that ye would altogether hold your peace! and it should be your wisdom.
verses.ct: If only you would be completely silent! That would be the wisest thing you could do.

verses.kjv: Hear now my reasoning, and hearken to the pleadings of my lips.
verses.ct: Listen now to my argument, and pay attention to the case my lips are making.

verses.kjv: Will ye speak wickedly for God? and talk deceitfully for him?
verses.ct: Are you going to speak dishonestly on God's behalf? Will you use deception to defend him?

verses.kjv: Will ye accept his person? will ye contend for God?
verses.ct: Will you show favoritism toward him? Will you argue God's case for him?

verses.kjv: Is it good that he should search you out? or as one man mocketh another, do ye so mock him?
verses.ct: Would it go well for you if he examined you closely? Can you fool him the way you might fool another person?

verses.kjv: He will surely reprove you, if ye do secretly accept persons.
verses.ct: He will certainly rebuke you if you secretly show favoritism.

verses.kjv: Shall not his excellency make you afraid? and his dread fall upon you?
verses.ct: Wouldn't his majesty terrify you? Wouldn't overwhelming dread from him fall on you?

verses.kjv: Your remembrances are like unto ashes, your bodies to bodies of clay.
verses.ct: Your memorable sayings are as worthless as ashes, and your defenses are as fragile as clay.

verses.kjv: Hold your peace, let me alone, that I may speak, and let come on me what will.
verses.ct: Be quiet and leave me alone so I can speak, and let whatever happens to me happen.

verses.kjv: Wherefore do I take my flesh in my teeth, and put my life in mine hand?
verses.ct: Why should I put myself at such risk, taking my life into my own hands?

verses.kjv: Though he slay me, yet will I trust in him: but I will maintain mine own ways before him.
verses.ct: Even if he kills me, I will still trust in him — but I will defend my conduct to his face.

verses.kjv: He also shall be my salvation: for an hypocrite shall not come before him.
verses.ct: This itself may be my salvation, because a hypocrite would never dare to come into his presence.

verses.kjv: Hear diligently my speech, and my declaration with your ears.
verses.ct: Listen carefully to what I say, and let my explanation reach your ears.

verses.kjv: Behold now, I have ordered my cause; I know that I shall be justified.
verses.ct: Pay attention — I have prepared my case. I know that I will be proven right.

verses.kjv: Who is he that will plead with me? for now, if I hold my tongue, I shall give up the ghost.
verses.ct: Who can bring a charge against me? Because if I stay silent now, I will die.

verses.kjv: Only do not two things unto me: then will I not hide myself from thee.
verses.ct: Just grant me 2 things, God, and then I won't hide from you.

verses.kjv: Withdraw thine hand far from me: and let not thy dread make me afraid.
verses.ct: Remove your heavy hand from me, and stop letting your terror overwhelm me.

verses.kjv: Then call thou, and I will answer: or let me speak, and answer thou me.
verses.ct: Then call on me, and I will respond — or let me speak, and you answer me.

verses.kjv: How many are mine iniquities and sins? make me to know my transgression and my sin.
verses.ct: How many sins and wrongdoings do I have? Show me exactly what my offense and sin are.

verses.kjv: Wherefore hidest thou thy face, and holdest me for thine enemy?
verses.ct: Why do you withdraw your favor from me and treat me as your enemy?

verses.kjv: Wilt thou break a leaf driven to and fro? and wilt thou pursue the dry stubble?
verses.ct: Will you terrorize a wind-blown leaf? Will you chase after dry straw?

verses.kjv: For thou writest bitter things against me, and makest me to possess the iniquities of my youth.
verses.ct: You write bitter accusations against me and hold me accountable for the sins of my youth.

verses.kjv: Thou puttest my feet also in the stocks, and lookest narrowly unto all my paths; thou settest a print upon the heels of my feet.
verses.ct: You lock my feet in shackles and watch every step I take; you even mark the soles of my feet.

verses.kjv: And he, as a rotten thing, consumeth, as a garment that is moth eaten.
verses.ct: So a person wastes away like something rotting, like clothing eaten by moths.
